question: Lizzy? Lizzy. What are you doing here?
answer: Playing with my friend.

question: Your friend?
answer: He lives under the bed. You scared him...

question: Jesse! Freddy... Wake up, sleepy head. Time to wake up.
answer: I had a bad dream.

question: Me, too.
answer: I was scared.

question: Don't worry... they can't hurt you.
answer: Promise?

question: That's Jesse. Let's go, Lizzy.
answer: Oh, look at the time! I've got to be going... anyone need me to bring anything home tonight?

question: I need an alarm clock.
answer: What's wrong with your old one?

question: Good morning! Hey, what's the matter?
answer: My mom...

question: And...?
answer: I had another dream last night...

question: Was I naked?
answer: No. You were Jason.

question: I'm standing here with State Trooper Captain Renton Murdoch, the man the Governor has called in to deal with the cultists because of his past experience with occult-style murderers. In fact, Trooper Murdoch is the only law enforcement officer ever to survive a one-on-one encounter with notorious Camp Crystal Lake killer -- Jason Voorhees. You received some pretty nasty injuries in your battle with Jason, didn't you, Captain?
answer: Nothing serious... just a few stitches.

question: What about these so called "Freddy" cultists? They seem like pretty tough customers. Think you'll have any trouble getting them out of there?
answer: No. Now that the Governor has given me complete authority to deal with these punks I should be putting an end to their situation pretty quick. Unless of course their attorney is able to get them to come out peace- fully... but I don't hold out much hope for that.

question: Captain Renton Murdoch, ladies and gentlemen. A tough cop... for tough criminals.
answer: Damn media... oughtta be a law. Is that shyster still in there trying to talk them out?

question: Damn media... oughtta be a law. Is that shyster still in there trying to talk them out?
answer: Yeah... he's making them some kind of deal.

question: Damn lawyers... what a bunch of assholes. Shakespeare was right -- kill all the lawyers. Then we could kill all the punks with no hassles and the world would be a safer place.
answer: Smaller anyway.

question: Ahhhhh... what did Shakespeare know? Long-haired, English freak. He was probably a punk.
answer: Jesus Christ!

question: Freeze!
answer: Hold your fire! Hang on, honey... I'll have you out of there in a second.

question: Looks like we'll have to hunt the rest of them down. Let's go before they get too far.
answer: We can't leave! Can't you see we've got a situation here?

question: Leave her.
answer: You're crazy! I can't just leave her!

question: Forget it. I've seen this before. There's nothing you can do.
answer: I've got to try...

question: You're wasting your time.
answer: Fuck it! CLEAR OUT! SHE'S GOIN' BLOW!!!

question: Punks.
answer: Are you okay, honey? NO! Jesus... you were going to kill that kid, weren't you?

question: I told you you were wasting your time. Once these kids go rabid, best thing to do is put 'em down.
answer: You can't be serious...

question: Dead serious. See... the world is made up of rules. Kids don't like rules. They rebel for a while, but ultimately they start to fall in line and become ordinary Joe's like you and me. But some kids... dope smokers mainly, watching their MTV... Satanic lyrics melting what's left of their brains... these kids grow up to be punks. And when these punks step as far over the line as these "Freddy" punks have -- then we as peace officers have no choice but to kill them.
answer: I didn't become a peace officer to kill kids.

question: Meagan!?
answer: Yes, ma'am?

question: I asked if you were ready to give your oral report?
answer: Yes... I'm ready.

question: Please come up here to the podium. You won't think it's funny when you haven't learned the fundamentals of a free market economy... oh, why do I waste my breath? You're all going to grow up to be gas station attendants and waitresses anyway. Go ahead, Meagan.
answer: My report is on Global Economic Trends. Try and think of a world where there is no poverty... no sickness... no crime. A world where everyone is happy to be alive and everyone lives together in peace. This is my dream. This dream is becoming a reality with ever-growing international business...

question: Sure...
answer: Meagan? Can you hear me? Do you know where you are?

question: I was day dreaming and then I woke up but then it was like I was still dreaming and then I woke up and then I guess I fainted and now I'm awake again...
answer: Are you sure? Meagan?

question: I'm waiting to see if you're going to turn into Freddy.
answer: Freddy... I see. You've been watching too much CNN. That crazy "Freddy" cult thing -- it's all over the TV day and night -- you can't get away from it. No wonder you kids are all having nightmares.

question: But this one was different... it felt real.
answer: But that's just it, Meagan... dreams aren't real. They're just broken fragments of the subconscious mind.

question: Fear is real though, isn't it? And if nightmares are fear, then doesn't that make them real?! And if the nightmares are real then is reality like a dream?!
answer: Meagan! You've got heat prostration... that's all.

question: Old witch... what does she know? She isn't even qualified to give a shot and she's telling me that my dreams aren't anything to worry about.
answer: So she said you were okay?

question: Oh, sure... Madame Curie in there says it's just a case of heat pro- stration and an overdose of TV news. Ruined my makeup, too.
answer: So you're going back to class?

question: No. She gave me last period off.
answer: Well, what are you bitching about? I could have a compound fracture of the skull and she wouldn't excuse me from P.E.

question: Jesse! I've been having nightmares for almost two weeks now and they keep getting worse! Now I'm having daymares! I want to know why!
answer: Okay... well, didn't the nurse say it was heat probation?

question: You don't understand... I want to know more about dreams. What they mean... why we have them.
answer: Okay, Meg, go look it up. You've got the rest of the day off, that's all I'm saying.

question: That's a good idea. Why don't you cut last period and come with me?
answer: Sure. Where are we going?

question: The library.
answer: You want me to cut school so we can go to the library?

question: Find anything?
answer: What? Oh, no... nothing yet.

question: Did you know that our sub-conscious retains everything that ever happened to us? Everything. From the time we're born until we die.
answer: Really?

question: That's how Freddy gets at us... by using our sub-conscious fears. Fears our conscious minds have repressed or forgotten.
answer: I've got a news flash for you... Freddy's dead.

question: I'm not so sure... if Freddy exists in our sub-conscious then he can never be fully erased. Like a bad memory... you may blot it out of your mind but it will alway be hiding someplace in your dreams. Weren't you scared as a child by something so stupid that you're ashamed to admit it?
answer: No.

question: No?
answer: Well, yeah.

question: Well, what? What is it?
answer: Well... when I was kid, my brother took me to the carnival. And in the penny arcade there was this robot gunslinger...

question: Black Bart.
answer: You know about Black Bart?

question: Duh. You put your quarter in and he says, "Go ahead and draw, tenderfoot." And then you pull your gun out and shoot him.
answer: That's just it -- I never could! I'd point the gun right at him and shoot, and I could never hit the guy. So I always got killed.

question: No one can hit him -- it's a gyp.
answer: Scared the shit out of me. Isn't that scary? I mean... for a kid? Okay, smartass... what about you? What scared you the most as a kid?

question: You're stupid!
answer: No, you are!

question: They forgot you again!
answer: No, they didn't!

question: Yes, they forgot and you're goin' to wait out here until it's dark and then the monsters are goin' come and get you!
answer: No they won't, because I'm walkin' home!

question: Dad... what's wrong? What's happened? Where's Lizzy?
answer: She didn't come home from school today. The police got a report that a girl fitting Lizzy's description was forced into a car by some crazies. They're pretty sure it was this "Freddy" cult.

question: Oh, my God...
answer: Now don't worry. The police are doing everything they can.

question: Where are we going?
answer: Over to Stormie's.

question: Stormie? I thought you and her weren't friends anymore since she stole that twenty dollars from you.
answer: That was her "klepto" phase... when she was dating that gang member. She dumped him a long time ago.

question: I still don't understand. What has she got to do with Lizzy missing?
answer: She used to be in the Freddy cult. Maybe she knows where they took Lizzy.

question: If I did know I would call the police, you know that. I love Lizzy. No telling what those freaks will do to her. Those Freddy cult guys are hard core.
answer: I thought you were in the cult?

question: I was in the cult for a week cause my boyfriend at the time... Slasher, he was. But I just liked the music and the clothes... when they were clean, but not like the violence and stuff. But that was just my "cult" phase... but I got past that. You know, just like my "gang" phase when I was dating Ramon and then before that was my "death rock" phase when I was dating Stuart...
answer: Uh, excuse me... but what phase are we in now?

question: Militant feminist, man-hating phase, what's it fuckin' to ya?!
answer: Why don't you just let the cops find her? That guy Renton Murdoch -- he knows how to deal with these cultist psychos. He was the man who got Jason Voorhees.

question: Jason kicked his ass.
answer: But even with his head hacked open and his brains leaking out, Murdoch still managed to put his last bullet in Jason's eye.

question: They say he hasn't been the same since.
answer: So what's different about him?

question: Erwin Kelper! He used to be in the Freddy cult! I bet he knows where they took Lizzy!
answer: Not Squirmin' Erwin -- that freak that used to eat bugs?

question: Who else? Erwin is scary smart -- always brought home "A"s -- but he was kinda fucked up, too... I mean, who isn't really? Anyway, he quit the cult a few months back and the cops put him away for his own safety. They say Freddy's put a death hex on Erwin.
answer: A death hex?

question: I already told the cops everything I know.
answer: Tell me... please.

question: Look... I'm sorry about your sister, but I've got my own problems with Freddy. I'm a marked man, you know.
answer: Then tell me why they took her...

question: To bear his child. Freddy wants to be human again. In order to do that he has to be "reborn".
answer: How can he do that?

question: Hey, they're not my rules... some- body else wrote 'em.
answer: Erwin... you've got to help me find Lizzy. You're my only hope.

question: I'll help you find your sister, but you've got to help me.
answer: Anything. Just name it.

question: Okay... okay... I'll do it. And I'm not a wimp! I need a quarter for the phone.
answer: Springwood Mental Center... how can I help you?

question: There's a bomb planted in your building.
answer: Who is this?

question: If I were you -- I'd get my ass out of there. Oh, yeah... Freddy Lives.
answer: Hey, Erwin... where do you think you're going? I'm talking to you, asshole!

question: Damn! We must have just missed them!
answer: Oh, my God -- she was here! This is part of Lizzy's shirt! It's all torn! Erwin... we've got to find her!

question: We're too late! There's no way... except...
answer: Except what?!

question: We could go after Freddy.
answer: How?

question: We'll inject ourselves with Dream Dope. It's a mild narcotic that brings on a dreamlike state.
answer: Okay... let's do it!

question: Meagan... we don't do drugs! I mean, what if one of us gets hooked or something? We could turn out like him!
answer: Don't worry about it. We need you wide awake anyway.

question: What for?
answer: We're going to go under and try to find Freddy. When we do, we'll grab him and bring him here. Then you kill him with this...

question: This rusty chunk of shit? What good is this?
answer: It's not the gun, it's what's in it -- silver bullets blessed by a priest.

question: Will that work?
answer: Should. But then...

question: Looking for some-body?
answer: I've got him! Wake us up! Wake us up! Don't just stand there! Wake us up!

question: Hmmmmm... I feel like seafood tonight. Stew on this, bitch!
answer: Shoot him! Shoot him!

question: Well, well, well... if it isn't my ol' pal, Erwin. I've got something special in mind for you...
answer: You didn't help me, you pussy! I could've had him! You gutless... spinless... jelly fish!

question: Ain't nothin' to see, girly... 'cept a bunch of ol' graves.
answer: Look, mister... can you give us directions or not?

question: You're not goin' up there to do somethin' stupid, are you?
answer: Stupid? Like what?

question: Like dig up Jason Voorhees -- that's what!
answer: Jesus... why would anyone do that?

question: It's Freddy! Jesse's hurt real bad... we've got to get him to a doctor.
answer: Don't worry... an ambulance is on the way.

question: Oh, God... Jesse...
answer: Meagan... listen to me... The cops are on their way. If they find me and Jason Voorhees in the trunk there, we're finished.

question: Jesse!
answer: Okay, Sheriff... This nightmare ain't big enough for the two of us... draw!

question: Jesse! Wake up! Wake up!!
answer: Three's a crowd, bitch! Why don't you just go get

question: Jesse, wake up! WAKE UP!!
answer: Go ahead... make my dream!

question: Just missed 'em. Where'd you get the truck?
answer: Same place I've got Jason hid.

question: And where's that?
answer: A place where no one ever goes.

question: What'd you do -- take him for a swim?
answer: Almost. Is she going to be alright?

question: I don't know. She's pretty fucked up. God, I don't know why I'm not...
answer: You're a strong woman.

question: What's that supposed to mean?
answer: Uhhh... nothing. I didn't mean anything.

question: Is this him?
answer: Yeah... Meet the new and improved Jason.

question: Why'd you put that stupid mask on him?
answer: Take a look...

question: Good idea.
answer: Not exactly a beauty queen entry, is he?

question: So what do we do now -- sing an Ozzy Osbourne song backwards or something?
answer: I'm afraid it's not that simple...

question: I thought you said you knew how to bring him back to life?
answer: I do! But when I was putting him back together, I noticed something was missing.

question: Awwww, he won't be needing that... I mean, what girl would let him put his rotten ol'...
answer: No-no! Not that! It's his heart... it's missing.

question: Well... does it really matter? Can't you use an aquarium pump or something?
answer: No... he has to have a heart. A human heart. A good one.

question: They said they were writin' for some newspaper...
answer: Teenagers are notorious liars.

question: Well, after I heard about the accident on my police scanner, I came up here to have a look. When I found it I figured you'd want to know right away.
answer: You did the right thing.

question: Jason! Git your ass over here! What did I teach you, boy? Don't ever take your mask off out in public. I don't want nobody to see that ugly mug of yours. Go git in the woodshed. Drop them overalls and lay over them logs...
answer: Jason! Come here!

question: What are you doing woman?
answer: I saved up some money... I want you to take and go on up to that summer camp just up the road. Tell the man you want to stay there.

question: Just what the hell do you think you're doing, bitch?!
answer: I'm sending him away for a few weeks.

question: You ain't sending him nowhere. Bring me that money, boy!
answer: Go on now... go!

question: Goin' ag'in me? I'll take you to the shed, woman!
answer: You ain't ever taking anyone to the shed ever again. Go on, son... have a good time! Mommy will come and git you some day soon!

question: Fine by me! Damnit! It's dead!
answer: He's right behind me!

question: You're the one who brought him back to life!
answer: And?!

question: Well, do something! Oh, some hero!
answer: STOP! Now... just stop! We're the ones that brought you back to life. And you have no right to kill us with that chainsaw! In fact... you owe us...

question: That's right! She gave you her boyfriend's heart, you know!
answer: That's right. Look! Here's his picture... Now, I know that you've been through a lot. And I know that you're pissed off about being murdered and all.

question: I know I would be!
answer: But if you help us kill Freddy Krueger... I promise to help you find the little bastard that killed you. What do you say? Have we got a deal?

question: Getting something to eat might help. Yo, Butch!
answer: It's Deputy Miller.

question: Excuse me, Deputy Miller but could we have something to eat?
answer: I thought you psychos only ate human hearts?

question: And I thought you pigs only ate donuts.
answer: Don't make me come back there.

question: Cow! I hope she chokes on her three combo-burrito cud!
answer: What am I going to do? I'll never be able to find Lizzy now.

question: You should be worrying about your- self... I know I am.
answer: I bet you're sorry you came with me now...

question: Nah... what are best friends for? Afterall, you stuck by me through all my crazy phases, I figure I owe you one big crazy phase, right?
answer: That's for being my best friend, Stormie.

question: What's the matter, honey... you don't like our company?
answer: I like you... sure. It's just that I usually shower alone, that's all.

question: Oh! So you're shy? I like 'em when they're shy... Don't fight it, baby! You know you want me... If you won't give me a piece then I'll just cut one for myself...
answer: Wait a second... I didn't mean to do that... I'm sorry. It's just that you come on a little strong, that's all. Just give me a little time to adjust to my new surroundings...

question: Are you saying you want me now?
answer: Yes... I want you.

question: Prove it. Now that's more like it! Hey, this bitch is alright! You're okay, honey... what's your name?
answer: Meagan.

question: So... what're you in for, Meagan?
answer: Oh, my friend...

question: The bitch that died last night?
answer: Yeah... they said she had some disease that made her... explode! Oh, God! Please hold me!

question: Easy... honey. It's goin' be alright. But what I asked you is why you're in here?
answer: Oh... well... the cops? Well, they think I gave it to her...

question: This is Captain Renton Murdoch -- State Trooper. I'm giving you until the count of three to come out with your hands up... Hand me that flare pistol.
answer: Good idea. Throw a little light on them -- see if we can spot their firing positions...

question: Alright, now I'm through playing "nice guy" -- I want the rest of you punks to come out right now with your hands up.
answer: Well, it doesn't look like they're going to surrender.

question: What we're going to need then is somebody to charge their lines -- make a hole for us to slip in.
answer: Where are you going to find anyone that crazy?

question: NO!
answer: You forgot to check under the bed.

question: No monsters here.
answer: But what if they come back?

question: Then we'll just have to kick their ass again.
answer: I love you, Meagan.
